symptom_desc: Little interest or pleasure in doing things
representative_words: anhedonia, disinterested, apathy, bored, indifferent, diminished pleasure, lack motivation, lack enthusiasm, low engagement

symptom_desc: Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
representative_words: sad mood, depressed, hopeless, feeling down, feeling empty, low mood, dysphoria, melancholy, emotional despair

symptom_desc: Trouble falling or staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Feeling tired or having little energy
Poor appetite or overeating
Feeling bad about yourself or that you are a failure or have let yourself or your family down
representative_words: guilt, self-blame, self-loathing, self-disgust, let down, failure, inadequate, defeated, disappointed, unworthy, embarassed, disgraced

symptom_desc: Trouble concentrating on things
representative_words: trouble concentrating, poor focus, distractible, short attention span, inattentive

symptom_desc: Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed? Or so fidgety or restless that you have been moving a lot more than usual?
representative_words: psychomotor retardation, psychomotor agitation, moving slowly, speaking slowly, moving a lot, sluggish, lethargic, fidgety, agitated, hyperactive, jittery, restless

symptom_desc: Thoughts that you would be better off dead, or thoughts of hurting yourself in some way
representative_words: suicidal thoughts, suicidal ideation, self-harm thoughts, self-injury thoughts

symptom_desc: Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge
Not being able to stop or control worrying
representative_words: can't control worrying, can't stop worrying

symptom_desc: Worrying too much about different things
Trouble relaxing
Being so restless that it's hard to sit still
Becoming easily annoyed or irritable
Feeling afraid as if something awful might happen
Repeated, disturbing memories, thoughts, or images of a stressful experience from the past?
representative_words: disturbing memory, disturbing thoughts, disturbing images

symptom_desc: Repeated, disturbing dreams of a stressful experience from the past
Suddenly acting or feeling as if a stressful experience were happening again (as if you were reliving it)?
Feeling very upset when something reminded you of a stressful experience from the past
Having physical reactions (e.g., heart pounding, trouble breathing, or sweating) when something reminded you of a stressful experience from the past?
Avoid thinking about or talking about a stressful experience from the past or avoid having feelings related to it
Avoid activities or situations because they remind you of a stressful experience from the past
Trouble remembering important parts of a stressful experience from the past
Loss of interest in things that you used to enjoy
representative_words: anhedonia, disinterested, apathy, bored, indifferent, diminished pleasure, lack motivation, lack enthusiasm, low engagement

symptom_desc: Feeling distant or cut off from other people
representative_words: detached, withdrawn, alienated, isolated, distant, cut off, estranged

symptom_desc: Feeling emotionally numb or being unable to have loving feelings for those close to you
Feeling as if your future will somehow be cut short
Trouble falling or staying asleep
Feeling irritable or having angry outbursts
Having difficulty concentrating
representative_words: trouble concentrating, poor focus, distractible, short attention span, inattentive

symptom_desc: Being “super alert” or watchful on guard
Feeling jumpy or easily startled?
